articles.headline: ‘Let Obamacare Fail,’ Trump Says as G.O.P. Health Bill Collapses
articles.snippet: The seven-year Republican quest to repeal the Affordable Care Act seemed to reach a dead end Tuesday, but President Trump vowed to “let Obamacare fail.”
articles.abstract: The seven-year Republican quest to repeal the Affordable Care Act seemed to reach a dead end Tuesday, but President Trump vowed to “let Obamacare fail.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The seven-year Republican quest to undo the Affordable Care Act appeared to reach a dead end on Tuesday in the Senate, leaving President Trump vowing to let President Barack Obama’s signature domestic achievement collapse.

articles.headline: Frances Gabe, Creator of the Only Self-Cleaning Home, Dies at 101
articles.snippet: Equal parts quixotic dreamer and accomplished visionary, Ms. Gabe made the house do its own scrubbing.
articles.abstract: Equal parts quixotic dreamer and accomplished visionary, Ms. Gabe made the house do its own scrubbing.
articles.lead_paragraph: For decades, Frances Gabe did not clean her house, nor did anyone clean it for her. Yet for all that time, it was spotless.

articles.headline: Trump Finds That Demolishing Obama’s Legacy Is Not So Simple
articles.snippet: Few if any presidents have spent as much time as Mr. Trump has in trying to undo their predecessor’s work rather than promoting their own ideas.
articles.abstract: Few if any presidents have spent as much time as Mr. Trump has in trying to undo their predecessor’s work rather than promoting their own ideas.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s demolition project just got shut down, at least for now.

articles.headline: Trump and Putin Held a Second, Undisclosed, Private Conversation
articles.snippet: There is no official American record of the prolonged discussion between the two presidents on the sidelines of the Group of 20 summit meeting.
articles.abstract: There is no official American record of the prolonged discussion between the two presidents on the sidelines of the Group of 20 summit meeting.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Hours into a dinner with world leaders who had gathered for the Group of 20 summit meeting, President Trump left his chair at the sprawling banquet table and headed to where President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia was seated.

articles.headline: Behind a Chinese Powerhouse, a Web of Family Financial Ties
articles.snippet: For nearly 25 years, HNA Group, the Chinese conglomerate, has funneled business to a small group of relatives and associates of its senior executives.
articles.abstract: For nearly 25 years, HNA Group, the Chinese conglomerate, has funneled business to a small group of relatives and associates of its senior executives.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Hainan Airlines wanted to expand in the 1990s, its top executives turned to a little-known businessman in his early 30s, who helped the Chinese upstart develop golf courses, resorts and seaside villas.

articles.headline: Hansa Market, a Dark Web Marketplace, Bans the Sale of Fentanyl
articles.snippet: The synthetic opioid has been at the center of a nationwide overdose epidemic. Its ban on a popular vending site has spurred a debate on free market ideology.
articles.abstract: The synthetic opioid has been at the center of a nationwide overdose epidemic. Its ban on a popular vending site has spurred a debate on free market ideology.
articles.lead_paragraph: A free market ideology has long been the prevailing ethos on the online markets where drugs and stolen credit cards are for sale.

articles.headline: Saudi King’s Son Plotted Effort to Oust His Rival
articles.snippet: The heir to the throne, Mohammed bin Nayef, was held in a palace in Mecca and forced to yield to Mohammed bin Salman, 31, who became the new crown prince.
articles.abstract: The heir to the throne, Mohammed bin Nayef, was held in a palace in Mecca and forced to yield to Mohammed bin Salman, 31, who became the new crown prince.
articles.lead_paragraph: AMMAN, Jordan — As next in line to be king of Saudi Arabia, Mohammed bin Nayef was unaccustomed to being told what to do. Then, one night in June, he was summoned to a palace in Mecca, held against his will and pressured for hours to give up his claim to the throne.
articles.byline: By Ben Hubbard, Mark Mazzetti and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: In Juries, Lawyers Now Favor the Uninformed
articles.snippet: Jury selection in Martin Shkreli’s trial followed the growing tendency to cut not only jurors who have an opinion, but also those who know anything about a case.
articles.abstract: Jury selection in Martin Shkreli’s trial followed the growing tendency to cut not only jurors who have an opinion, but also those who know anything about a case.
articles.lead_paragraph: By the second morning of jury selection in Martin Shkreli’s fraud trial in Brooklyn, more than 130 prospective jurors had been tossed out: people with vacation or work conflicts, those who had heard about the case and even several who worked in pharmaceuticals or finance, fields in which Mr. Shkreli has worked.

articles.headline: How Y2K Offers a Lesson for Fighting Climate Change
articles.snippet: Some remember the computing scare as a bad joke. But the collective, worldwide effort to prevent calamity could be a model for handling global warming.
articles.abstract: Some remember the computing scare as a bad joke. But the collective, worldwide effort to prevent calamity could be a model for handling global warming.
articles.lead_paragraph: Last week, New York magazine published a riveting and frightening look at the future of the planet we call home. Now that global warming is well underway, we are in for an apocalyptic awakening, and “parts of the Earth will likely become close to uninhabitable, and other parts horrifically inhospitable, as soon as the end of this century,” the writer, David Wallace-Wells, argues.

articles.headline: Trump Demands That Senators Find a Way to Replace Obamacare
articles.snippet: A day after he seemed to give up his legislative push, President Trump summoned Republican senators to tell them not to leave Washington until they repeal and replace Obamacare.
articles.abstract: A day after he seemed to give up his legislative push, President Trump summoned Republican senators to tell them not to leave Washington until they repeal and replace Obamacare.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump ordered senators back to the negotiating table on Wednesday for a last-ditch effort to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act, just one day after angrily accepting the measure’s demise and vowing to allow President Barack Obama’s signature domestic achievement to crater.
articles.byline: By Julie Hirschfeld Davis, Thomas Kaplan and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Media Consolidation Is in the Air, and John Malone Is Fanning It
articles.snippet: The billionaire mogul is said to be interested in investing in Univision. And Discovery has held merger talks with Scripps.
articles.abstract: The billionaire mogul is said to be interested in investing in Univision. And Discovery has held merger talks with Scripps.
articles.lead_paragraph: More than ever, the media industry is hurtling toward greater consolidation. And consummate deal makers like John C. Malone, the 76-year-old telecommunications billionaire, are increasingly testing the waters for potential transactions.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Emily Steel
